definitions: Relating to or characteristic of a legalistic approach or interpretation; overly concerned with legal technicalities or strict adherence to legal forms.
Pertaining to the science or philosophy of law; jurisprudential.
examples: His legistical interpretation of the rules missed the spirit of the law.
The committee's legistical approach to the minor infraction caused unnecessary delays.
She found the legistical arguments of the defense to be pedantic.
